benchmark_details.name: DASHBOARD QA
benchmark_details.overview: DASHBOARD QA is the first benchmark explicitly designed to assess how vision-language GUI agents comprehend and interact with real-world dashboards, including 405 question-answer pairs with interactive dashboards spanning five categories: multiple-choice, factoid, hypothetical, multi-dashboard, and conversational.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate question answering over interactive dashboards and to enhance the capabilities of vision-language and GUI agents in realistic analytical reasoning tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark is tableau-centric, limiting visual and topic diversity.

data.source: Collected interactive dashboards from Tableau Public

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is based on the proportion of correct answers to questions across multiple observations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in navigating and reasoning over dashboards.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement was measured at 74.93%, with revisions for inconsistencies.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Dashboards collected were non-controversial, focusing on neutral and academic sources.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All dashboards were taken from Tableau Public, which are publicly available.
